page.title: 03THE BATCHES
page.content: The mine spoil-tips or "batches" are an integral feature of the landscape. Nearly every village in the area had one or sometimes two pits working in the heyday of the Somerset coalfield and although the mine-workings and surface buildings have almost totally disappeared, the batches remain as a distinct reminder of those days. Most were planted with conifers, partly to avoid offending the eye of the gentry and also as a means of occupying striking miners. The ecology is unique. Tips not tree planted have a natural covering of grass and scrub. They now support a wealth of plant and animal life which has adapted to the coal and shale soil. There is now a real danger that these batches will disappear as concentrated farming and building becomes necessary.
